com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read

Class DbfTableReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read.AbstractTableReader
      • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read.AbstractSubTableReader
        • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read.FileTableReader
          • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.read.DbfTableReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SubTableReader, TableReader

    public class DbfTableReader
extends FileTableReader
    The DbfTableReader class is a TableReader which reads DBF (dBase-format) files into data tables.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllColumnNames

        protected java.lang.String[] getAllColumnNames()
        Description copied from class: AbstractSubTableReader
        Get all of the column names in the table (as opposed to just those for the columns being kept). User defined data types (via setColumnNames(String...) will override these values; nonetheless, this method should always return valid names for each column. Changes to the columns to keep will cause the reader to use the names returned from this method until a user overrides them; that is, these names form the default names for the table.
        Specified by:
        getAllColumnNames in class AbstractSubTableReader
        Returns:
        the names of all of the columns in the table, in the order that they occur.

      • getAllColumnTypes

        protected DataType[] getAllColumnTypes()
        Description copied from class: AbstractSubTableReader
        Get all of the column types in the table (as opposed to just those for the columns being kept). User defined data types (via setColumnTypes(DataType...) will override these values; nonetheless, this method should always return valid types for each column. Changes to the columns to keep will cause the reader to use the types returned from this method until a user overrides them; that is, these types form the default types for the table.
        Specified by:
        getAllColumnTypes in class AbstractSubTableReader
        Returns:
        the types of all of the columns in the table, in the order that they occur.

      • getDataIterator

        protected java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Object[]> getDataIterator()
        Description copied from class: AbstractSubTableReader
        Get an Iterator which iterates over all the rows of data in the table, in their correct order. The arrays of data should contain all of the columns (not just those from the columns to be kept) and each data element should be of the correct type corresponding to its column's data type. Data in the array corresponding to columns which are not going to be kept will be ignored, so correctly typing those elements is unnecessary. Because column types may be set externally, the typing should be performed using a combination of AbstractSubTableReader.getColumnTypes() and AbstractSubTableReader.columnsToKeep, not AbstractSubTableReader.getAllColumnTypes().
        Specified by:
        getDataIterator in class AbstractSubTableReader
        Returns:
        an iterator which cycles over all of the rows in the table.
